fields.headline: A picture of failure
fields.bodyText: Imagine my horror and disbelief on viewing your (usually impeccable) homepage at theguardian.com and finding that you have unaccountably posted a large photograph of two wholesome and attractive young men in a somewhat homoerotic rugby tackle, celebrating their A-level results. To add insult to injury, one of them is wearing a cardigan. Please could you remove this offending image forthwith and replace it with a smiling picture of some blonde totty from public school wearing a low-cut top who has got herself five A*s and is going to Oxford. Catherine Dean London • In the interests of balance, all newspapers should be legally obliged to publish a full page of photos of students who have achieved dreadful exam results. The unalloyed euphoria captured in the pages of successful entrants is a little hard to take, speaking as an 11-plus failure. Mike Scott Bath
